intro: Micromeles meghalayensis, commonly known as the Meghalaya wild vine, is a rare flowering plant native to the northeastern region of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and small, fragrant flowers. The plant exhibits unique botanical features, including its slender stems and clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in the dense forests of Meghalaya. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
